Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2008 01:49PM cinrae123 wrote: Drea,,,,,,,,,,,,you are welcome for the advise.  Looks like you got some good ideas from all the ladies.  Let me share something else with you,,,,,,,,,,,Losing my hair was the most devastating thing for me.  For me I felt that I was losing me.   If that makes sense. So anyways,  I took my daughter with me to the wig shop,,,,,,,,,,and for some odd reason,,,,,,,,,I couldnt get out of the car for a long time and I just sat there and laughed.  Why I chose to laugh,,,,,,,,I'm not even sure. Maybe if I didnt laugh I would have cried I guess.  But seeing all those wigs on the hair stands,,,,,for some reason just made me laugh,  And a wig being called a cranial prostethis made me laugh too.  Strange huh?  Guess that was my way of dealing with the loss of my hair.  I was absolutely devastated.  But when you are feeling so sick from chemo,,,,,,,,,,my hair being gone seemed non important anymore.  Everyone is so different.  I have a small head so hats and scarves looked funky on me.  So I chose the wig.  Which I wore all the time,,,,,,except at night when I was ready to retire to bed.  I admire women who can go commando though.  Thats awesome. I see nothing wrong with going to the wig shop,,,,,,looking around,,,,,,,trying them on,,,,,,,,then just tell her you will think about it and be back.  Then go on line and find the same thing for cheaper.   I mean,,,,,,,,,why not?  With the rise in cost in everything,,,,,,,,,I am after bargains.  lol My insurance didnt cover a wig.........not sure why,,,,,,,,,,,guess all insurances are different. Good luck with your decision and I am sure you will find something. Cindy
Posts.Title: Share the details of your wig with me? Drea angie27

Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2008 10:40AM cinrae123 wrote: Hey girls,,,,,,,,,I bought the brand Noriko. I think the style was called Ryan,,,,,,,,that is if I remember correctly.  It was also a monofilament top and synthetic.  I totally loved it,,,,,,,,and I got so many compliments,,,,,,,,,people thought it was my real hair.  And so easy to take care of. I washed it in wig soap,,,,,,,,,put it on a head stand,,,,,,,,and it dried in no time.  No styling needed at all.  Only use the hair spray for synthetic wigs too,,,,,,,,just a suggestion.  But like I said,,,,,,,I absolutely loved mine.  People said it looked better than my own hair. lol  The picture here is with that wig on.  I finished chemo Aug 2007 and finished herceptin May 2008,,,,,,and it hasnt been until a couple of weeks ago that I started going wigless.  Hair just took a while to come back in and I havent been comfortable until recently going out in public without something on my head.  I got mine at a wig shop,,,,,cost $350,,,,,,but so well worth it.  And it still looks great,,,,,,I bought it in May 2007.  Good luck,,,,,,I am sure you will find something you like.  There is lots to choose from.  Cindy
Posts.Title: Share the details of your wig with me? Drea angie27

Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2008 10:52AM cinrae123 wrote: Its me again,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,I just wanted to add another thing in here.  A few weeks ago I went with my daughter to get my real hair trimmed as it was growing in very uneven.........so my daughter was sitting in the chair getting her hair highlighted and the hairdresser (who we always go to and she knows us) says to me............."Go and look in some of our books and see if there is a new style you would like to try out"  My daughter and I looked at each other smiling,,,,,,because I guess she thought that that was my own hair.  She knew nothing of my journey thru breast cancer.  So when it was my turn,,,,,,,,she says.........."so how do you want it cut today and lets go shampoo you".  I looked at her and said,,,,,,,,,,,,"ooooooo Judy, this is a wig,,,,I had breast cancer and lost all my hair but the hair underneath this wig needs to be trimmed and maybe you can give me some suggestions as to what to do with it"  She saysssssssssssssssss .... "omggggggg I had no idea that is a wig,,,,,,,it looks soooooooooo real".  So see,,,,,,,,,,,if a hairdresser thought it was real,,,,,,,it must look ok right?  lol Just thought I would share that cute story with you. Cindy
Posts.Title: Share the details of your wig with me? Drea angie27

Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2007 05:07PM cinrae123 wrote: Hi,,,,,,,,,,I have a question about the Nioxin.  Well,,,,first does it really help with the hair growth,,,,and second,,,,,,do you have to keep using it for forever.  Like if you stop using it will your hair fall out?  Dumb question I know,,,,,,sorry. Cindy
Posts.Title: Nioxin products Nicole MaryGLA

Posts.Content: cinrae123 wrote: Question,,,,,,,,,,is anyone taking neurontin for hot flashes?  I was taking Effexor but that wasnt working so my onc changed it to neurontin.  I just started today,,,,,,,,,and you have to take 3 a day.  Taking the first one was fine,,,,,,but after I took the second one,,,,,,,I felt weird in the head.  I have to take my 3rd one now.  I'm just wondering,,,,,,,,,does my body have to get used to this stuff and will it get better the longer I take it. And how long does it take to work on the hot flashes? So if anyone is taking neurontin for hot flashes,,,,,,,,,please tell me your experience with it.  It would be muchly appreciated. Cindy Cindy Dx 1/2007, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Neurontin for hot flashes cinrae123 cinrae123

Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2009 02:12PM cinrae123 wrote: Hi ladies.  I have a question.  I am 1 year and 7 months past chemo,,,,,,,and almost a year past herceptin.  My hair has come back,,,,,,,,,but it is extremely thin.  I can deal with the back being thin,,,,,,,,,,but omgggggggg the top is awful.  You can see my scalp.  My son took a picture of me at the museum the other day,,,,,,,,,,,and I was just horified at how thin it looked.  Dont know if it was the light in there or what,,,,,,,,,,,but just absolutely depressing.  I have used Nioxin and I take Biotin every day (I heard that helps with hair growth).  I am just sick about this.  Should I continue to be more patient,,,,,,,,,,,or is this the best its gonna be.  I stopped using the Nioxin,,,,,,cause I wasnt really sure it was helping.  Has anyone had permanent thinning of their hair?  I was on taxotere, carbo and herceptin.  Please help with suggestions on things that really truly worked for you all,,,,,,,,,,,,,or would like to hear from others on permanent hair thinning.  The one thing I had a hard time with during my journey was losing my hair,,,,,,,,,,was told it would grow back (which it did),,,,,,,,,,,and now I'm back in the same depressing mood about this.  Any comment would be appreciated.  I am desperate. Thank you
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2009 08:22PM cinrae123 wrote: Spring,,,,,,,,ty for the info about the henna.  I will order some.  Anddddddd your hair looks adorable.  I was never comfortable going wigless until my hair was like 2 inches long.  I so admire those of you that do.  Awesome. Ok,,,,,,,,so I went to the dematologist yesterday,,,,,,,about my hair being so thin,,,,,,,,,,,,,,and I guess what she would typicallly give ladies,,,,,,,she cant give to those who have had breast cancer.  But she said I could try Rogaine,,,,,,,,only thing about that is you have to keep using it because if you dont,,,,,,the hairs that come in will eventually fall out again.  Then she suggested going to an accupuncturist.  My onc suggested that to me quite some time ago for hot flashes but couldnt find one that was on my insurance plan.  Welllllllllllll it just so happens that my dermatologists sister is an accupuncturist and is on my ins plan.  So I made an appt for this monday.  I guess she has had great success with women with thinning hair regain their hair back and also with hot flashes.  Its worth a shot I thought.  I really know not much about accupuncture,,,,,,,,,,does anyone here know how it all works?  Would love anyones input.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Apr 25, 2009 07:55PM - edited Apr 25, 2009 07:57PM by cinrae123 Hi ladies.  Ok I went to get accupuncture last Monday.  And had another one yesterday.  She says that she has had great success with her patients that have hair thinning due to chemo or stress or whatever.  So we will see. She works in conjunction with several MD's.  She is also treating me for hot flashes (which I have to say,,,,,have gone down quite a bit in only two treatments) and also for this darn excess weight that has been bugginnnnnnnn me.  I do notice that I eat less,,,,,,,and last night I seemed to sleep better (which I have been having a hard time with the sleeping because of the hot flashes and I am an internal worry wart, lol)  Its all pretty interesting though.  After the treatments I had such a feeling of calm.  She kinda explained it like this,,,,,,,,,,our bodies have been thru so much that our system is out of whack,,,,,,,,and needs to get back in order.  Get that blood flowing again, help with our red and white counts.  Like a tree,,,,,,,,we cant just rub the leaves and expect the whole tree to look pretty and healthy,,,,,,,,we need to work from within the core of the tree.  This is all very new to me and sometimes a bit overwhelming,,,,,,but I figured if my onc suggested it for hot flashes and my dermatologist for hair,,,,,,,,,,,,there has to be something to it huh?   Of course I would like to wake up one day looking like a chia pet.  The hair is so thin on top that I felt I was almost gonna have to do the Donald Trump combover.  lol  Not sure how many treatment I will be having but I'll keep you posted. Question?   what is the hair fattening stuff?  Have a good weekend and love reading all of your posts ladies. Congrats to those of you going topless.   I sooooooo admire those of you that can.  I could just never get myself to that place,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,so a huge kudos to you ladies. Cindy
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2009 09:55PM - edited Apr 29, 2009 09:59PM by cinrae123 That is so cool that you are able to get some free wigs and all.  Very awesome indeed.  I was told at the wig shop when I got mine,,,,,,,that real hair is very hard to manage,,,,,,and the synthetic ones were actually better.  I had a synthetic one with the monofilament top (which means there is a nylon see thru monofilament panel on the top and if the wig is styled with a part,,,,,you cant even tell its a wig because you can see your own scalp thru the  panel.)   I got mine at a wig shop,,,,,,,and totally loved it.  I got so many compliments on my hair,,,,,,people didnt even realize it was a wig,,,,,,they just thought I had gotten it highlighted and cut.  lol  The synthentic ones are already styled and never lose their shape or style.  Soooooooo easy.  I washed mine like once a week and just put it on one of those wig stands,,,,,,,,,,it dried super fast,,,,,,and I was good to go. Just be careful with the synthetic ones,,,,,,,,,cause if you like open up the oven make sure your head is away from that heat.  Ive heard that some people have actually singed the hairs and they got like fuzzy.  Love,,,,,,,tell your friend she will be fine.  She will get thru this journey,,,,,,,and before she knows it,,,,,,,it will be a distant memory.  Tell her to find a thread on this site  or start one  up herself for others going thru treatment the same time as her.  It was such a blessing for me during my treatment.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 1, 2009 10:10AM cinrae123 wrote: everyminute,,,,,,,,,,,,,cuuuuuuuuuuute hair.  You gals with your pics here of you with short hair,,,,,,,,,,,is sooooooo adorable.  When my hair was growing, I couldnt do that with mine.  Mine is very fine and thin.

Posts.Content: May 20, 2009 11:04AM - edited May 20, 2009 11:06AM by cinrae123 Lainey,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,yes it is true if you stop using Rogaine the hairs that came in will eventually fall out.  My dermatologist said it was good to use,,,,,,,,just expect to keep using it for forever if you want to keep those hairs.  Ive been doing accupuncture,,,,,,,,,,,and i am getting new hairs.  My hair came back but very thin,,,,,,,,,,,specially on the top.  The back you can kinda just style so you dont see it,,,,,,,,,but the top you can see the scalp.  Although with the new hairs coming in its lookin better. Just wanted to add also,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,when I did radiation I used Miaderm.  Worked wonderfully.  They have a website you can go to to buy it.  Just look up Miaderm on the search.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 27, 2009 04:13PM cinrae123 wrote: chelev,,,,,,,,,,,good advice on the synthetic wigs for Jo.  Thats all I did too.  Washed it in synthetic wig shampoo (you can buy at the beauty supply places or wig shops), put it on the wire head I bought,,,,,,and just let it air dry.  Then shook it out after it was dry and put it on.  They are much better so they say than human hair wigs.  As they are cut for that style and stay that way.  Just be careful opening up the oven,,,,,,,,as Ive heard some people have singed the hairs.  lol  You can also get wig hair spray. I actually loved my wig.  Wished my own hair would be like my wig was.  lol To the two of you gals that are going to meet in person,,,,,,,,,very cool for you.  I met two of the ladies from another thread several months ago in person.  And it was just wonderful to meet people that we had been sharing so much with.  What was funny was,,,,,,,,,we hardly even talked about BC.  Just had a great opportunity to meet and get to know them in person.  Enjoy your meeting. Have a good week all.

Posts.Content: May 7, 2009 04:24PM - edited May 7, 2009 04:28PM by cinrae123 Hi ladies.  enjoy,,,,,,,,,,,,I finished chemo in Aug 2007,,,,,,,,,,,and did herceptin till May 2008,,,,,,,,,,and I wasnt able to go wigless untill July 2008. And even then it was short. So dont feel bad. I know exactly how frustrating this is. I know that herceptin slows the hair growth.  Mine has come back but very thin on the top.  I too used nioxin and I take Biotin every day.  I asked my onc about and she said she just didnt know what to say except go to a dermatologist.  So I went,,,,,and she said the stuff she prescribes for people she cant give to patients who have had cancer. Figures, huh?  She suggested using the Rogaine for Men but be careful when applying as to not to your face as you will get hair where ever you touch if you have it on your hands.  But also,,,,,,,,,,the hair will come back using the Rogaine but if you stop,,,,,,those hairs that came in will fall out. Whats the point huh?  I was hoping for something permanent. She also suggested doing accupuncture.  I have had 5 accu treatments so far and I swear I can feel lil hairs coming in.  Will let you know more,,,,,,,the more treatments I have. I also am doing accu for hot flashes.  They have decreased a lil but not gone all the way. I am also having a very hard time losing weight.  I missssssssss my estrogen.  I believe that not taking estrogen is messing my body up.  It sucksssssssssssss. Sphynx,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,omggggggggggg I cant believe how much hair you had in that picture taken n 2005.  WTF did u do?  Thats awesome I am jealous of your women whos hair has come back thicker.  Good luck all. Patience is a virtue which I dont have sometimes.  lol

Posts.Content: May 25, 2009 04:17PM - edited May 25, 2009 04:23PM by cinrae123 Hey girls..........about the Prisms,,,,,,,,,,now when u say that a tube will last over a year?  Do you just put it on the roots?  I'm gonna have to check that out.  I also colored my hair when it was about 1/2 in long,,,,,,,,,I couldnt stand the gray.  lol  I do use the Revlon hair color,,,,,,,,I guess I've never been too worried about the chemicals and all,  I really never thought about it being so harmfull.......or I'm just plain ignorant,,,,, but maybe I should be concerned.  Yikes. Now I'm worried.  ooooooo and about those of you that say your husbands like the color it is now?  You just do what is right for YOU.  Its your hair,,,,,,,,,and your decision.  Do what makes YOU feel good.  Chelev,,,,,About your sister saying its just hair? omg,,,,,,,,easy for people to say that stuff huh?  For me the hardest thing was losing my hair.  Not that its all that and a bag of chips,,,,,,but I think for us women it identifies who we are.  Maybe thats not a good way to be,,,,,,,,I dont know. I was never comfortable going wigless,,,,,,,,,but that was just a personal thing for me.  I totally admire women who can go topless,,,,,,,,,and wished I could've been that way.  Big kudos to those of you women that could. But it pisses me off when people say things like,,,,,,,"what are you worried about, its just hair, it will come back"  Yeah,,,,,,,easy for them to say,,,,,,,,they didnt lose their hair. Mine came back but way thinner than it used to be.  Maybe its my payback for being so obsessed about losing it.  lol And why is it that the products that they have for getting hair back,,,,,,,,such as the Rogaine and that other stuff that Cil was talking about for eyelashes,,,,,,,,the hair grows back but when you stop using it those hairs will fall out again?  Sooooooooooo not fair. Lisa1964,,,,,,,,,,,,are you the same Lisa1964 that posted on the TCH thread?  If so,,,,,,,,good to hear things are going well with you. Have a good Memorial Day ladies.

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2009 11:06PM - edited Jun 29, 2009 11:22PM by cinrae123 omg,,,,,,,,,,I am sooooooooo jealous.  Here I am two years out from chemo, and one year out from herceptin,,,,,,,,,,,and sure the hair has grown,,,,,but not nearly as filled in as you all. Sad when in the sun you can see my scalp. Im just so preplexed about this.  Is it pay back for me because I was sick to death about the fact of losing my hair in the first place? Ive had all kinds of tests done and my thyroid and b12 and everything is fine,,,,,,,,what could be wrong?  Ive been doing accupuncture and taking my biotin,,,,,,,and it has filled in a little,,,,,,just a little,,,,,,but nothing like it used to be.  I wonder if not taking estrogen could attribute to it? I miss my estrogen big time........these hot flashes are the pits too. This is depressing............but great for you all.  Jeeze,,,,,,,,,,,whats everyones secret?
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jun 30, 2009 12:38AM cinrae123 wrote: Lisa,,,,,,,,,,o yeah I've been taking Biotin for a loooooooong time,,,,,,,,,,,5000 a day.  My onc just said,,,,,,,,,,I dont know. She headed me to a dermatologist,,,,,,,,,and my dermatologist gives this medication to people with my problem but she doesnt give it to cancer patients. Figures huh? Then the dermatologist headed me to a accupuncture gal. So ive been doing that for a couple of months now.  It has filled in somewhat,,,,,,,but absolutely nothing like it used to be.  Depending on the light,,,,,,when I have my picture taken you can see my scalp.  Specially during the day when I'm out in the sun,,,,,,,its so thin and scalp scalp and more scalp.   I did taxotere, carboplatin and herceptin.  I just get so bummed out.  My accu lady says to be patient as my body has gone thru a lot of stuff............but not so easy to do,,,,,,,,,easy for people to say that when they dont have this problem.  Sorry for venting,,,,,,,,,its just getting really upsetting.  Specially when I see you gals hair and its so full.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Nov 14, 2008 05:07PM - edited Nov 14, 2008 05:12PM by cinrae123 I have a quick question ladies.  I am over a year out of chemo,,,,,,,,and I finished my herceptin May of this year. ...,my hair did not change one bit.  Same color and still fine.  It actually has come back even way thinner than it used to be,,,,,,especially on the top.  It sucks.  Has anyone else experienced that?  I keep thinking it will fill in more,,,,,,,but I dont see much advancement in that dept.  Sucks when you can see your scalp. I have been taking Biotin because they say that helps.  lol   I go to the see the onc in Dec and she is going to run some thyroid tests.  Been bloated, back ache, having a really hard time losing weight, tired and the hair thing too.  Did anyone experience this kind of stuff after chemo and all?  Can chemo kind of mess up your thyroid?  Thanx ladies....................
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2009 07:04PM cinrae123 wrote: Springtime,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,o yes, I take Biotin every single day.  Thats why I am asking this question.  Any other ideas ladies.  omg,,,,,,,,,,,,is this the best its gonna be?  This seeing my scalp is really getting to me.  Depressing to say the least.

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2009 10:03PM - edited Apr 28, 2009 10:05PM by cinrae123 I will let u know for sure.  My first accu was a week ago, My hot flashes have decreased.  They havent gone away all together but having less than before.  I dont feel as hungry either.  So we will see.  Yes,,,,,,,my insurance covers accupuncture.  And she is on my EPO plan too so my co pay is only $15.  I figured it was worth a shot.  Will keep you all informed.

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2009 11:37PM cinrae123 wrote: another quick question.  My dermatologist said if one uses Rogaine (and she said it works great) but the hairs that come in will fall out when u stop using it.  Does anyone know if Nioxin works the same way?
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: cinrae123 wrote: Anyone out there taking Neurontin for hot flashes?  And what has your experience been?  Anyone experience feeling bloated or weight gain?  Andddddddddd did it reduce the hot flashes,,,,,,,,or go away all together?  I've been taking it for a few weeks now,,,,,,,,,,and the hot flashes havent gone away altogether.  I might have one or two less a day,,,,,,,and thats it.  I have noticed an extreme bloatedness..........so was wondering if thats from the Neurontin.  Any input would be muchly appreciated. Cindy Cindy Dx 1/2007, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: anyone taking neurontin for hot flashes cinrae123 cinrae123

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2007 05:01PM - edited Oct 1, 2007 05:01PM by cinrae123 Just popping in,,,,,,,,,,,I'm from the May group.  Dont mean to intrude but the bad taste struck me.  I too had that horrible taste (metallic) where absolutely everything tasted awful.  I finished chemo 5 weeks ago and the taste does go away.  It took about 3 weeks after chemo for it to be gone all the way,,,,,,,,but now I can taste again.  Just be patient,,,,,,,,,,it will come back to normal.  lol Take care girls,,,,,,,, Cindy
Posts.Title: I want my taste back! Help! StillKicking Sofie

Posts.Content: May 21, 2008 12:07AM cinrae123 wrote: Hello ladies,,,,,,,,,I usually post in the chemo 07 group,,,,,,,but saw this one related to effexor.  I started taking it about 5 weeks ago,,,started out on the low dose then increased to the 75.  My hot flashes were awful thats why I am taking it.  I have noticed a slight decrease,,,,but my onc also suggested for me to take some Vit E too.  So thats what I have been doing for a couple of weeks now.  She told me to increase my effexor to double the 75,,,,,,but shoot,,,,,,,I just dont know if I want to even go there on that.  So I talked to her and I will continue with the 75 and Vit E and see if that works.  They seem to be less,,,,,but not gone all together.  O well,,,,,,,,I guess I will give it more time.  Interesting reading what all you ladies have to say about effexor though.  Thank you.  I will just be patient, huh? Take care,,,,,,,,,Cindy
Posts.Title: Anyone Had Good Results with Effexor? bluewillow Caya

Posts.Content: cinrae123 wrote: Hey anyone.  I am 10 past my last chemo and almost 2 months past my last herceptin.  Hair on top is 2 inches and in the back is about 3 inches.  The hair is very fine and on the top it is thin.  Anyone else experience this?  Will it fill in on the top?  I take Biotin and use the Nioxin too.  This is depressing for me.  I am glad its growing finally but sooooooo slow and thin on the top.  This sucks.  I see pics of other ladies 1 year past chemo and they have a full head of hair.  Just not fair. Cindy Cindy Dx 1/2007, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2008 10:33PM cinrae123 wrote: Ellie,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,I am so sorry that you are having an awful time.  I finished my herceptin the end of April and I didnt have any side effects.  Only thing I think happened was my vision and my contacts bugged me a lot during that time,,,,,,but now that I am finished I think I am all back to normal.  Hang in there girl................3 more treatments to gooooooooo. Posts.Content: Jun 22, 2008 09:17PM - edited Jun 22, 2008 09:21PM by cinrae123 Hi Carolina,,,,,,,,,,,omg its so nice to hear from you.  Yeah,,,,,my hair has always been fine and thin but it just seems thinner on the top.  Ima hopping it fills in more.  Have you had a haircut yet?  How long is it and do you go "topless"?  lol  It's just a lesson in patience I guess. Is that a picture of you and your daughter?  How cuuuuuuuuute. I'm glad you will be finishing up your treatment soon.  Good for you.  Hard to believe that a few months ago we were in the midst of chemo huh?  I look back at it now and say,,,,,,,,,,,,,wow, Cindy, I am proud of you.  lol  Just as I am proud of you also and all the other ladies before me. I hope life is treating you well.  Post occassionally and let me know how things are going ok?  Nice to know that we all move on after bc huh?  I post occassionally on the site to check in with others, new ones and old ones.  I feel for those going thru this now and just want to lend them an ear and tell them that there is light at the end of the tunnel. Have a great week. Cindy
